meanings.definition: Things that exist or are used or enjoyed for only a short time.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the falling leaves is an ephemera that reminds us of the passing seasons.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was a dazzling ephemera that lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The melting ice cream cone was an ephemera that brought both joy and sticky fingers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like ephemera, fleeting but unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The bubbles in the fizzy drink popped like ephemera, disappearing in an instant.

meanings.definition: Items of collectible memorabilia, typically written or printed material.
meanings.sent1: The antique postcards are valuable ephemera sought after by collectors.
meanings.sent2: The old movie posters are interesting ephemera that showcase the history of cinema.
meanings.sent3: The vintage ticket stubs are quirky ephemera that tell stories of past events.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of rare stamps is like a treasure trove of ephemera waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The faded photographs are fragile ephemera capturing moments frozen in time.
